article.headline: Delaware 64, Old Dominion 62
article.story: NEWARK, Del. (AP) -- Mike Ames made a 3-point shot with just 1.8 seconds left to play as Delaware came back to beat Old Dominion 64-62 on Saturday. Ames scored 18 points and rallied the Hens after trailing by 12 points with 12:28 left to play. Delaware (9-6, 3-3 Colonial Athletic Association) hit on 11 of its final 16 shots from the field. Henry Olawoye and David Lunn each scored seven points off the bench while the Hens' other four starters each netted six points. Old Dominion (9-5, 4-1 CAA) had a seven-game winning streak snapped and lost its first conference game of the season. Old Dominion had a chance to win the game but Alex Loughton's 25-foot shot at the buzzer bounced out. Loughton, Old Dominion's leading scorer, sat out most of the second half due to foul trouble and finished with 11 points and pulled six rebounds. John Waller, Arnaud Dahi, and Troy Nance also scored 11 points each to pace Old Dominion. The Hens rallied back to win from a double-digit halftime deficit for the second time this season.
